intro: Paullinia manarae, commonly known as the Manarae passionflower, is a climbing vine native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that resemble those of the passionfruit. The plant produces small, edible berries that are sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are often heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and twining. Paullinia manarae plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
